definition: in the depth of night/late at night
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)

sentences.english: Why are you getting up in the middle of the night?
sentences.chinese: 要是半夜三更窃贼进入我的房间，我就会扔东西打他。

sentences.english: I went out in the still of the night.
sentences.chinese: 我出走那是半夜三更一片寂静。

sentences.english: Making a dinner together and have one frozen to save on the witching hour?
sentences.chinese: 一起做晚餐，半夜三更给她温暖？

sentences.english: He would even wake up in the middle of the night to have a smoke.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至是半夜三更醒了也要抽上一根。

sentences.english: And it was already mid-night when I arrived there .
sentences.chinese: 当我到达那里是已是半夜三更。

sentences.english: Think about this – I would get up and go out in the middle of the night and what would I be doing?
sentences.chinese: 我会半夜三更起来出去，我会去干什么？

sentences.english: If a burglar came into my room at night I'd throw something at him.
sentences.chinese: 要是半夜三更窃贼进入我的房间，我就会扔东西打他。

definition: in the depth of the night/very late at night
midnight/in the middle of the night
lit. the black sky of midnight/very late at night (idiom)
the whole night/all through the night
to grope about in the dark
variant of 醉醺醺[zui4 xun1 xun1]
